text: Finished Hasselback potatoes Hasselback potatoes or Potato à la Hasselbacken (Swedish: Hasselbackspotatis) are a type of baked potato, where they are cut about halfway through into thin fan-like slices. They are most often served with the main course, but can also be adapted into a side dish or canapé. Various toppings can be added, such as caraway seeds, paprika, or breadcrumbs. ==Origins== Hasselback potatoes were created in 1953 by Leif Ellison, a trainee chef at Hasselbacken restaurant on Djurgården, Stockholm. ==References== Category:Potato dishes Category:Swedish cuisine
title: Hasselback potatoes
